description: This joke humorously plays on the word 'draft' referring to both a military conscription and a breeze or preliminary version of a written work.
title: Draft-Resistant Books
n_1: Inside the library, General Pages discusses army recruitment.
c1_1: We need more books in our ranks!
c2_1: But General, some books despise the draft!
c2_2: They fear being left in a cold, drafty room!
n_3: General Pages chuckles, realizing the misunderstanding.
c1_3: Ah, a different kind of draft!
c2_3: Exactly, more of a breeze than a duty!
n_4: Both share a laugh amidst the library shelves.
c1_4: Well, let's respect their choice to stay cozy!
c2_4: Agreed, no drafts for these books!
